question: Assessment of malnutrition is done by:-

question: Which of the following indicator is used for growth monitoring at Anganwadi centre?
exp: ANGANWADI CENTRE ICDS GROWTH CHA Nutritional staus of the child is assessed against Weight for age Separate chas for girls and boys 3 zones: Normal zone (grey), Under-nutrition below -2 SD (light grey), severe underweight below-3 SD (dark grey).

question: A child of 10 years has a mental age of 2 years, his IQ level is:-
exp: IQ = Mental age /Chronological age x 100 In the given question, chronological age is 10 years and mental age is 2 years. Thus, IQ level of this child= 2/10 x100=20 IQ points. Such a child will be an Idiot child with Severe mental retardation. Normal IQ 70 or above Mild mental retardation = 50-70 Moderate mental retardation = 35-49 Severe mental retardation = 20-34 Profound mental retardation = <20

question: MAC has color coding. Yellow color indicates mild to moderate malnutrition. What is the reading of MAC on yellow color?
exp: SHAKIR'S TAPE: - Measures Mid arm circumference (MAC) - It has colour coding. Green is normal i. e. MAC >13. 5cm yellow is mild to moderate malnutrition with MUAC 12. 5 - 13. 5cm and Red is severe malnutrition with MAC <12. 5cm.

question: Types of Growth Chas used by Anganwadi workers (ICDS) for growth monitoring
exp: ICDS GROWTH CHA: In NRHM and ICDS, Government of India has adopted WHO Child Growth Standards (also known as MGRS 'Multicentre Growth Reference Study' Standards) Normal zone - Road of health Below -2 SD: Malnutrition Below -3 SD: Severe Malnutrition

question: If ASHA found any child lies in yellow area according to ICDS growth cha:-
exp: ICDS Growth Cha:- This cha is based on MGRS standards (Multicentre Growth Reference Study standards) Standard to -2. SD is GREEN which requires home based management -2 to -3 SD is mild to moderate malnutrition which is YELLOW and this child is referred to PHC. Below -3. SD is severe malnutrition which is RED and this child should be immediately referred to higher centre.
opa: Child is referred to higher center

question: Weight by height is normal for a child but he is low height by age. He is:-
exp: Low height for age: Stunting / Dwarfism (Chronic PEM) Low weight for height: Wasting / Emaciation (Acute PEM) Low weight for age: Underweight. (Acute on chronic PEM)
